tool.name: Selection

param.name: input_purpose
param.expression: General Reference | Thematic Vector | Thematic Raster | Geospatial Analysis (Distance) | Geospatial Analysis (Area) | Navigation Routes (Geodesic) | Navigation Routes (Loxodrome) | Ranges of Activity | Flow Patterns | World Index
param.dialogReference: Select appropriate purpose from the drop-down list which best suits the particular map output or requirements of the ArcMap project.

param.name: in_dataset
param.displayname: Input Area (Feature Class or Raster Dataset/Catalog which defines area of interest)
param.dialogReference:
Select an existing feature class which defines the geographical footprint of the map output or analysis project. Each Purpose has appropriate input data types, which can be a single polygon, a set of point / line / polygon features, or a raster dataset.

The feature class must be based on a geographical coordinate system.

For a single polygon input, ensure that this totally encompasses the geographical footprint required.

param.name: in_folder
param.displayname: Folder location for PRJ files generated for each candidate projection
param.dialogReference: Select an existing folder which will be used to store the .PRJ projection files generated for each candidate projection.

param.name: out_results
param.dialogReference: Provide a name for the results text file that will be generated by the tool.

param.name: in_gdb
param.displayname: File Geodatabase for datasets created by tool
param.dialogReference: Select an existing File Geodatabase which will be used to store various datasets generated by the tool. If necessary create the File Geodatabase prior to running the tool.

tool.summary: Outputs a list of candidate projections based on user input of Purpose and Footprint of Interest, generating a projection definition (.prj) file for each candidate. The same selection process undertaken by the Automated Projection Selection for ArcGIS (ArcMap Python Add-in) tool is used, but in this case there is no quantitative distortion assessment and the user is unable to interactively amend the data frame coordinate system to each candidate projection. The projection definition (.prj) files can be imported as normal using the data frame properties dialog.
